memory: think: I wasted all my turns by repeatedly issuing invalid/garbled commands instead of interacting with objects. Next time, I should (1) search for a rag by checking countertop 1, shelf 1, shelf 2, sinkbasin 1, bathtubbasin 1, and bathtub 1 with clear actions like “go to countertop 1” and “take rag 1 from …”; (2) if the rag is dirty, clean it using “clean rag 1 with sinkbasin 1”; then (3) go to toilet 1 and place it with “put rag 1 on toilet 1” (the back of the toilet).

think: Plan: Stop issuing garbled commands; immediately search for a wash cloth by going to countertop 1, shelf 1, shelf 2, sinkbasin 1, bathtubbasin 1, and bathtub 1, taking the wash cloth when found (e.g., “take washcloth 1 from shelf 1”). If it’s not clean, clean it with “clean washcloth 1 with sinkbasin 1”. Then go to toilet 1 and place it on the back side with “put washcloth 1 on toilet 1”.
